newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Westpac cuts Australia prime, housing rates.
newsitem.headline: Westpac cuts Australia prime, housing rates.

text.p: Westpac Banking Corp said it will cut its prime reference lending rate to 8.75 percent from 9.25 percent, effective June 3.
It also said it will cut its home loan rates.
Westpac said it will cut its standard variable home loan rate to 7.20 percent from 7.55 percent and its First Option home loan rate to 6.69 percent from 6.95 percent.
The new rates are effective for new customers from May 27 and for existing borrowers from July 18.
The reductions follow the Reserve Bank of Australia's announcement of a cut in the official cash rate to 5.5 percent from 6.0 percent on Friday.
Westpac said it will announce reductions in business rates on Monday.
